metadata.dc:author: del Pozo, M
Pérez, J A
Avendaño, R
Cardemil, B
metadata.dc:description: The signet ring variant of lobular mammary carcinoma is aggressive and metastasis to serosal surfaces. We report a 46 years old woman presenting with an intestinal obstruction due to a peritoneal carcinomatosis secondary to a signet ring cell carcinoma of the breast. After surgery, the patient received chemotherapy (5-fluorouracil, adriamycin, cyclophosphamide and tamoxifen). A satisfactory response, with regression of peritoneal carcinomatosis and a good quality of life, was achieved. The patient is alive after 2 years of diagnosis.
metadata.dc:title: Obstrucción intestinal por carcinomatosis peritoneal debida a carcinoma mamario de células en anillo de sello.
[Intestinal obstruction caused by peritoneal carcinomatosis due to signet ring cell carcinoma of the breast].
